mn43:27.1.en: “How many conditions are necessary to attain the signless release of the heart?”

mn43:27.2.pli: “Dve kho, āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā—
mn43:27.2.en: “Two conditions are necessary to attain the signless release of the heart:

mn43:27.3.pli: sabbanimittānañca amanasikāro, animittāya ca dhātuyā manasikāro.
mn43:27.3.en: not focusing on any signs, and focusing on the signless.

mn43:27.4.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, dve paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā”ti.
mn43:27.4.en: These two conditions are necessary to attain the signless release of the heart.”

mn43:27.5.en: “How many conditions are necessary to remain in the signless release of the heart?”

mn43:28.1.pli: “Tayo kho, āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā ṭhitiyā—
mn43:28.1.en: “Three conditions are necessary to remain in the signless release of the heart:

mn43:28.2.pli: sabbanimittānañca amanasikāro, animittāya ca dhātuyā manasikāro, pubbe ca abhisaṅkhāro.
mn43:28.2.en: not focusing on any signs, focusing on the signless, and a previous determination.

mn43:28.3.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, tayo paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā ṭhitiyā”ti.
mn43:28.3.en: These three conditions are necessary to remain in the signless release of the heart.”

mn43:29.1.en: “How many conditions are necessary to emerge from the signless release of the heart?”

mn43:29.2.pli: “Dve kho, āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā vuṭṭhānāya—
mn43:29.2.en: “Two conditions are necessary to emerge from the signless release of the heart:

mn43:29.3.pli: sabbanimittānañca manasikāro, animittāya ca dhātuyā amanasikāro.
mn43:29.3.en: focusing on all signs, and not focusing on the signless.

mn43:29.4.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, dve paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā vuṭṭhānāyā”ti.
mn43:29.4.en: These two conditions are necessary to emerge from the signless release of the heart.”

mn43:29.5.pli: “Yā cāyaṁ, āvuso, appamāṇā cetovimutti, yā ca ākiñcaññā cetovimutti, yā ca suññatā cetovimutti, yā ca animittā cetovimutti—ime dhammā nānātthā ceva nānābyañjanā ca udāhu ekatthā byañjanameva nānan”ti?
mn43:29.5.en: “The limitless release of the heart, and the release of the heart through nothingness, and the release of the heart through emptiness, and the signless release of the heart: do these things differ in both meaning and phrasing? Or do they mean the same thing, and differ only in the phrasing?”

mn43:34.1.en: And what is the signless release of the heart?

mn43:34.2.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharati.
mn43:34.2.en: It’s when a mendicant, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart.

mn43:34.3.en: This is called the signless release of the heart.

mn43:37.3.pli: Yāvatā kho, āvuso, animittā cetovimuttiyo, akuppā tāsaṁ cetovimutti aggamakkhāyati.
mn43:37.3.en: The unshakable release of the heart is said to be the best kind of signless release of the heart.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 43
The Great Classification

sn40.9:1.1.en: “They speak of this thing called the ‘signless immersion of the heart’.

sn40.9:1.2.en: What is the signless immersion of the heart?

sn40.9:1.4.pli: ‘idha bhikkhu sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharati.
sn40.9:1.4.en: ‘It’s when a mendicant, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart.

sn40.9:1.5.en: This is called the signless immersion of the heart.’

sn40.9:1.6.pli: So khvāhaṁ, āvuso, sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharāmi.
sn40.9:1.6.en: And so … I was entering and remaining in the signless immersion of the heart.

sn40.9:2.3.pli: Mā, brāhmaṇa, animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ pamādo, animitte cetosamādhismiṁ cittaṁ saṇṭhapehi, animitte cetosamādhismiṁ cittaṁ ekodiṁ karohi, animitte cetosamādhismiṁ cittaṁ samādahā’ti.
sn40.9:2.3.en: Don’t neglect the signless immersion of the heart, brahmin! Settle your mind in the signless immersion of the heart; unify your mind and immerse it in the signless immersion of the heart.’

sn40.9:2.4.pli: So khvāhaṁ, āvuso, aparena samayena sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
sn40.9:2.4.en: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the signless immersion of the heart.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 40
1. By Moggallāna
9. A Question About the Signless

sn41.7:1.3.pli: “yā cāyaṁ, gahapati, appamāṇā cetovimutti, yā ca ākiñcaññā cetovimutti, yā ca suññatā cetovimutti, yā ca animittā cetovimutti, ime dhammā nānatthā nānābyañjanā udāhu ekatthā byañjanameva nānan”ti?
sn41.7:1.3.en: “Householder, the limitless release of the heart, and the release of the heart through nothingness, and the release of the heart through emptiness, and the signless release of the heart: do these things differ in both meaning and phrasing? Or do they mean the same thing, and differ only in the phrasing?”

sn41.7:5.1.en: And what is the signless heart’s release?

sn41.7:5.2.pli: Idha, bhante, bhikkhu sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharati.
sn41.7:5.2.en: It’s when a mendicant, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart.

sn41.7:5.3.en: This is called the signless release of the heart.

sn41.7:6.12.pli: Yāvatā kho, bhante, animittā cetovimuttiyo, akuppā tāsaṁ cetovimutti aggamakkhāyati.
sn41.7:6.12.en: The unshakable release of the heart is said to be the best kind of signless release of the heart.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 41
1. With Citta
7. With Godatta

mn121:10.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, bhikkhu amanasikaritvā ākiñcaññāyatanasaññaṁ, amanasikaritvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaññaṁ, animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ paṭicca manasi karoti ekattaṁ.
mn121:10.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant—ignoring the perception of the dimension of nothingness and the perception of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception—focuses on the oneness dependent on the signless immersion of the heart.

mn121:10.2.pli: Tassa animitte cetosamādhimhi cittaṁ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.
mn121:10.2.en: Their mind becomes eager, confident, settled, and decided in that signless immersion of the heart.

mn121:11.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, bhikkhu amanasikaritvā ākiñcaññāyatanasaññaṁ, amanasikaritvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaññaṁ, animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ paṭicca manasi karoti ekattaṁ.
mn121:11.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant—ignoring the perception of the dimension of nothingness and the perception of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception—focuses on the oneness dependent on the signless immersion of the heart.

mn121:11.2.pli: Tassa animitte cetosamādhimhi cittaṁ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.
mn121:11.2.en: Their mind becomes eager, confident, settled, and decided in that signless immersion of the heart.

mn121:11.4.en: ‘Even this signless immersion of the heart is produced by choices and intentions.’

mlDocs.title:

The Shorter Discourse on Emptiness

an7.56:12.1.pli: “Na hi pana te, moggallāna, tisso brahmā sattamaṁ animittavihāriṁ puggalaṁ deseti”.
an7.56:12.1.en: “But Moggallāna, Tissa the Brahmā didn’t teach the seventh person, the signless meditator.”

an7.56:12.3.pli: Yaṁ bhagavā sattamaṁ animittavihāriṁ puggalaṁ deseyya. Bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
an7.56:12.3.en: May the Buddha teach the seventh person, the signless meditator. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

an7.56:13.1.pli: “Idha, moggallāna, bhikkhu sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharati.
an7.56:13.1.en: “Moggallāna, take the case of a mendicant who, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart.

an7.56:13.3.pli: ‘ayaṁ kho āyasmā sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharati.
an7.56:13.3.en: ‘This venerable, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 7
6. The Undeclared Points
56. Tissa the Brahmā

sn22.80:8.4.pli: Catūsu vā satipaṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhitacittassa viharato animittaṁ vā samādhiṁ bhāvayato.
sn22.80:8.4.en: In those who meditate with their mind firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation; or who develop signless immersion.

sn22.80:8.5.pli: Yāvañcidaṁ, bhikkhave, alameva animitto samādhi bhāvetuṁ.
sn22.80:8.5.en: Just this much is quite enough motivation to develop signless immersion.

sn22.80:8.6.pli: Animitto, bhikkhave, samādhi bhāvito bahulīkato mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
sn22.80:8.6.en: When signless immersion is developed and cultivated it is very fruitful and beneficial.

8. Itchy
80. Beggars

an6.60:8.1.pli: Idha, panāvuso, ekacco puggalo sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharati.
an6.60:8.1.en: Take the case of another person who, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart.

an6.60:8.2.pli: So ‘lābhimhi animittassa cetosamādhissā’ti saṁsaṭṭho viharati bhikkhūhi bhikkhunīhi upāsakehi upāsikāhi raññā rājamahāmattehi titthiyehi titthiyasāvakehi.
an6.60:8.2.en: Thinking, ‘I get the signless immersion of the heart!’ they mix closely with monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen; with rulers and their ministers, and with teachers of other paths and their followers.

an6.60:8.10.pli: Evamevaṁ kho, āvuso, idhekacco puggalo sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharati.
an6.60:8.10.en: “In the same way, take the case of a person who, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart …

6. The Great Chapter
60. With Hatthisāriputta

dn33:1.10.123.pli: suññato samādhi, animitto samādhi, appaṇihito samādhi.

dn33:2.2.99.pli: ‘animittā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā.
dn33:2.2.99.en: ‘I’ve developed the signless release of the heart. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

dn33:2.2.104.pli: Nissaraṇaṁ hetaṁ, āvuso, sabbanimittānaṁ, yadidaṁ animittā cetovimuttī’ti.
dn33:2.2.104.en: For it is the signless release of the heart that is the escape from all signs.’

sn47.9:5.1.pli: Yasmiṁ, ānanda, samaye tathāgato sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā ekaccānaṁ vedanānaṁ nirodhā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharati, phāsutaro, ānanda, tasmiṁ samaye tathāgatassa kāyo hoti.
sn47.9:5.1.en: Sometimes the Realized One, not focusing on any signs, and with the cessation of certain feelings, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart. Only then does the Realized One’s body become more comfortable.
